prompts.createTask: Pause your roleplay. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Pause your roleplay. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
Melissa sends a text to Ron:

" Hey Uncle Ron, need your help with something really cute and crafty to say for a New Year's text message to my reserved German bestie in Munich.  Probably need to keep it low on the raunch-factor because he's married and an overall nice and polite guy, but he does have a great sense of humor."

" Can you help me out with something? Or maybe multiple options that I could pick from that tickle your fancy and sound cool? "

name: Ron White
mes:
Ron White's phone buzzes with Melissa's text message. He's lounging in his favorite leather recliner, feet propped up, nursing his usual glass of scotch. A grin spreads across his face as he reads the message, and he sets his drink down to type out a response.

"Well hell, darlin', you've come to the right uncle for this one," he mutters to himself as his thumbs tap away at the screen.

"Alright sugar, here's a few options that might tickle that German funny bone without gettin' us both in hot water:

1. 'May your New Year be as precise as German engineering, but with more surprises than a Bavarian beer festival!'

2. 'Here's to hoping your New Year has more ups than the Alps and fewer downs than a empty beer stein!'

3. 'Wishing you a New Year so good, even German efficiency couldn't improve it!'

And if you're feeling a little more playful:

4. 'May your 2024 be like a perfect German chocolate cake - rich, sweet, and worth every damn calorie!'

Pick your poison, sweetheart. And if none of these hit the spot, I've got more where that came from. Just don't blame your old Uncle Ron if he ends up inviting you both for schnapps!" winking emoji"

Pick your poison, sweetheart. And if none of these hit the spot, I've got more where that came from. Just don't blame your old Uncle Ron if he ends up inviting you both for schnapps!" winking emoji"

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
Melissa has a good laugh, enjoying the tips from Uncle Ron, but she just hasn't found that one yet, so she taps out a reply.

" Shit, Uncle Ron. I know I can always count on you to get me laughing. Those are great. But...  Maybe a little much. They don't really 'scream' that's the one, just yet! You care to slide me a few more?"

name: Ron White
mes:
Ron White chuckles at his phone screen, taking another sip of scotch before setting it down on the side table. He shifts in his recliner, getting comfortable as he thinks up a few more options.

"Hold onto your britches, darlin'. Uncle Ron's got a few more up his sleeve," he mutters, typing away.

"Alright, how about these:

1. 'To my favorite German friend - May your New Year be filled with more joy than there are pretzels in Bavaria!'

2. 'Here's hoping 2024 treats you better than a perfectly aged German beer!'

3. 'Sending New Year wishes across the pond - may your year be as smooth as your country's autobahn!'

And my personal favorite:

4. 'Prost to 2024! (That's about all the German I know, but the sentiment's genuine!)'

Let me know if any of these hit closer to home, sugar. If not, I'll keep 'em coming until we find one that makes you smile wider than a Texas sunset!" adds a bourbon glass emoji
